name: ARBodyTrackingConfiguration
desc: A configuration that tracks human body poses, planar surfaces, and images using the rear-facing camera.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates a new body tracking configuration.

items.name: var initialWorldMap: ARWorldMap?
items.desc: The state from a previous AR session to attempt to resume with this session configuration.

items.name: var automaticSkeletonScaleEstimationEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A flag that determines whether ARKit estimates the height of a body that it's tracking.

items.name: var isAutoFocusEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that determines whether the device camera uses fixed focus or autofocus behavior.

items.name: var planeDetection: ARWorldTrackingConfiguration.PlaneDetection
items.desc: A value specifying whether and how the session attempts to automatically detect flat surfaces in the camera-captured image.

items.name: struct ARWorldTrackingConfiguration.PlaneDetection
items.desc: Options for whether and how the framework detects flat surfaces in captured images.

items.name: var automaticImageScaleEstimationEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A flag that instructs ARKit to estimate and set the scale of a tracked image on your behalf.

items.name: var detectionImages: Set<ARReferenceImage>
items.desc: A set of images that ARKit searches for in the user's environment.

items.name: var maximumNumberOfTrackedImages: Int
items.desc: The number of image anchors to monitor closely for position and orientation updates.

items.name: var wantsHDREnvironmentTextures: Bool
items.desc: A flag that instructs ARKit to create environment textures in HDR format.

items.name: var environmentTexturing: ARWorldTrackingConfiguration.EnvironmentTexturing
items.desc: The behavior ARKit uses for generating environment textures.

items.name: class var supportsAppClipCodeTracking: Bool
items.desc: A flag that indicates if the device tracks App Clip Codes.

items.name: var appClipCodeTrackingEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates if the framework searches the physical environment for App Clip Codes.

items.name: class ARAppClipCodeAnchor
items.desc: An anchor that tracks the position and orientation of an App Clip Code in the physical environment.
